name: Cucumber Salad
history: Cucumber Salad is a popular dish worldwide, known for its refreshing and light taste. It's a staple in many cuisines due to its simplicity and the cooling effect of cucumbers, making it a favorite especially in warm weather.
description: Cucumber Salad is a crisp and refreshing dish made primarily with sliced cucumbers. It's often dressed with a light vinaigrette or yogurt-based dressing and can be enhanced with herbs, spices, and other vegetables like onions or tomatoes.

instructions.title: Prepare the Cucumbers
instructions.description: Wash the cucumbers and slice them thinly. You can peel them if desired.

instructions.title: Combine Ingredients
instructions.description: In a mixing bowl, combine the sliced cucumbers, red onion, and chopped dill.

instructions.title: Make the Dressing
instructions.description: In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, olive oil, sugar (if using), salt, and black pepper.

instructions.title: Dress the Salad
instructions.description: Pour the dressing over the cucumber mixture and toss well to coat.

instructions.title: Chill and Serve
instructions.description: Refrigerate the salad for at least 30 minutes before serving to allow the flavors to meld.

tips: Use English cucumbers for a seedless and tender option.
Adjust the amount of vinegar and sugar to balance the tartness and sweetness.
variations: Add cherry tomatoes or bell peppers for extra color and flavor.
Substitute dill with mint or basil for a different herb profile.

storage.shelfLife: Best consumed fresh. Can be stored in the refrigerator for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

presentationTips: Serve in a clear bowl to showcase the salad's freshness.
Garnish with additional herbs or a sprinkle of sesame seeds for added visual appeal.
